response.original_title: TR speaking to a group of men from the porch at Sagamore Hill, 1916
response.overview: On May 27, 1916, groups of men, the 7th Regiment Band, and several children march on the road from the Oyster Bay railroad station to Sagamore Hill to demonstrate their support of TR for the 1916 Presidential nomination. Views of TR addressing the large crowd assembled on the lawn of Sagamore Hill. The rally was organized by the Roosevelt Non-Partisan League of New York City.
response.title: TR speaking to a group of men from the porch at Sagamore Hill, 1916

titles.title: Theodore Roosevelt speaking to a group of men from the porch at Sagamore Hill, 1916
